intro: Ptilotus parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaved ptilotus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and they bloom in late summer to early autumn. Ptilotus parvifolius is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh environments.
